Ayesha Khan.description: attending classes at Oak Hill College library (conversing about Wolfgang Schulz and Ayesha Khan are discussing ways to make their poetry reading event more inclusive by collaborating with LGBTQ+ organizations, incorporating sign language interpretation, highlighting the historical impact of systemic racism and the contributions of Black creators, hosting a workshop on allyship and privilege, centering Black LGBTQ+ individuals, inviting young aspiring poets from diverse backgrounds to share their work, collaborating with Black-owned businesses and artists, and featuring spoken word performances addressing unconscious bias and microaggressions, while also prioritizing showcasing the intersectionality of race and gender.) @ the Ville:Dorm for Oak Hill College:common room:common room table

Adam Smith.description: continuing to collaborate with Carlos on promoting diversity and inclusion (conversing about how to enhance an upcoming poetry reading event by incorporating diverse cultural elements, involving local Black artists and musicians, addressing unconscious bias, creating a safe space, prioritizing accessibility and historical context, involving Black LGBTQ+ activists, showcasing Black-owned businesses and artists, planning workshops on allyship and privilege, reaching out to local organizations, involving the student community, organizing mentorship opportunities for young Black leaders, incorporating multilingual readings and cultural performances, creating a platform for open dialogue and sharing personal experiences, actively listening to marginalized communities, collaborating with the local community, and involving speakers to discuss the intersectionality of race and gender.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room table
